newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine cancels 2004 global bond on volatility.
newsitem.headline: Argentine cancels 2004 global bond on volatility.

text.p: Argentina has cancelled plans to issue a new global bond due 2004 because the country does not want to pay the premium demanded by investors after currency volatility in South East Asia, the Economy Ministry said Monday.

"Investors are asking for a premium because of the volatility after Thailand. Therefore we decided to cancel because we did not want to pay this premium," said Federico Molina, the Economy Ministry's Director of Credit.
It had previously been announced that the 2004 bond had been delayed.
The ministry announced late Monday it had decided to expand its 2003 global bond by $500 million to replace the cancelled issue.
Salomon Brothers Inc. said in a separate statement it was the sole manager of the issue.

Molina added that, throughout the rest of the year, Argentina has $1.5 billion of debt to issue in international markets and 750 million pesos in local markets. These are part of the $12.1 billion total planned for 1997.
